document_data.name: Berkthgar
document_data.mainbody: '''Berkthgar''' was a [[Reghedman]] [[barbarian]] from the [[Tribe of the Elk]] of [[Icewind Dale]] who served as the chieftain of [[Settlestone]] in the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Description: The barbarian chieftain had wild brown hair, which fell across his strong shoulders. Berkthgar had muscles the size of [[dwarf]] thighs and stood 6 foot 6 inches (1.98 meters). To add to his imposing presence, the huge [[human]] had strikingly blue eyes.
document_data.Personality: As leader of Settlestone, Berkthgar lived in the shadow of [[Wulfgar]] and wanted [[Aegis-fang]] to demonstrate to his people he was the rightful chieftain of the Tribe of the Elk.
document_data.Possessions: When in battle, Berkthgar used a great [[flamberge]] called [[Bankenfuere]] the ''Northern Fury'' and wore a fur covered [[wikipedia:en:Jerkin (garment)|jerkin]]. The huge 4-foot-long (1.2 meters) [[sword]] rested in a leather sheath over his right shoulder.
document_data.History:
Berkthgar was the son of [[Beothgin]].

In the {{YearlinkName|1357}}, Berkthgar was an emissary between Settlestone and [[Mithral Hall]] who interacted with [[Bruenor Battlehammer|King Bruenor]]. In the {{YearlinkName|1358}}, [[Drizzt Do'Urden]] and Catti-brie traveled to Settlestone to resolve a disagreement Berkthgar had with Bruenor Battlehammer over Wulfgar's [[warhammer]], Aegis-fang.
